fullText: Danny DeVito brings his distinctive comic timing and unpretentious authenticity to Arthur Miller's family drama, anchoring a solid revival that benefits from Terry Kinney's sensitive direction.
dtliExcerpt: Danny DeVito brings his distinctive comic timing and unpretentious authenticity to Arthur Miller's family drama, anchoring a solid revival that benefits from Terry Kinney's sensitive direction.
bwwExcerpt: Continuing Roundabout's long history with Miller's work, this is a very solid, sensitively directed production of a flawed but rewarding play. It's no Death of a Salesman, but it still has much to say about capitalism and its costs to the striving American family.
showScoreExcerpt: Danny DeVito brings his distinctive comic timing and unpretentious authenticity to Arthur Miller's family drama, anchoring a solid revival that benefits from Terry Kinney's sensitive direction.
